list_ex_of_definition.ex_of_definition: Many people visited the shrine where the saint lay buried.

list_definition.definition: a usually highly-decorated case for holding holy objects.

list_ex_of_english: In 1745, control of 440 sites outside the gates of temples and shrines and 227 cho within their precincts were transferred to the city magistrate.
Most shrines were open and public.
The author's wellillustrated book is founded largely on his interviews with those connected with the shrines he visited.
The author concludes that the performance of specific rituals at particular shrines served as a process of identification.
Interchangeable vehicles of gifts and sacred forces varied from charms, witch-substance, relics and shrines, or the body of the ritual specialist him/herself.
I am told that £50 is the derisory sum that is offered to one chief for the loss of his shrines.
However, much controversy surrounds the question of who actually installed the shrines.
A specific mor tuary pattern, plus ceremonial activity in the form of on-floor burnings, help to indicate the function of these buildings, now identified as shrines.
